intro: Thesium scabrum, commonly known as rough thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems covered in rough, scaly bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. Thesium scabrum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
